curriculumRows.assessments:
Assessment 1: Written test. 
Assessment 2: Oral presentation. 
Assessment 3: Group project. 
Assessment 4: Portfolio. 
Assessment 5: Peer review. 
Assessment 6: Self-assessment. 
Assessment 7: Performance task. 
Assessment 8: Quiz. 
Assessment 9: Homework. 
Assessment 10: Class participation.
curriculumRows.materialsAndDifferentiation:
Materials: Wonders KG textbook, letter tiles, sight word flashcards, leveled readers, whiteboards, markers, iPads with reading apps, picture books, audio recordings, anchor charts, classroom library.

Differentiation: Small group instruction for struggling readers, advanced phonics activities for accelerated learners, visual supports for ELL students, hands-on manipulatives for kinesthetic learners, technology integration for engagement, peer reading partners, individualized reading goals.
curriculumRows.biblical: Biblical integration: Discuss creation story, kindness, honesty, forgiveness, love, respect, stewardship, gratitude, prayer, worship, service, compassion, generosity, faith, hope, trust, obedience, humility, patience, self-control, peace, joy, courage, wisdom, discernment, justice, mercy, grace, redemption, salvation, mission, evangelism, discipleship, spiritual gifts, fruit of the Spirit, armor of God, parables, miracles, Old Testament, New Testament, Psalms, Proverbs, Gospels, Acts, Epistles, Revelation.
curriculumRows.materials: Textbook: Wonders KG. Workbook: Phonics Practice. Manipulatives: Letter tiles, flashcards, whiteboards, markers, iPads, educational apps, storybooks, audio CDs, posters, anchor charts, classroom library, online resources, teacher-created materials, games, puzzles, art supplies, science kits, math manipulatives, music instruments, PE equipment.

curriculumRows.subject: Art
curriculumRows.assessments: mina was in art assassments

standards.description: Through experimentation, build skills in various media and approaches to art-making.
Identify uses of art within one's personal environment.
Create art that tells a story about a life experience.
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts.
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.
